component.name: google-storage
component.title: Google Storage
component.description: Store and retrieve objects from Google Cloud Storage Service using the google-cloud-storage library.
component.label: cloud

autoCreateBucket.label: common
autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the bucket bucketName.

serviceAccountKey.label: common
serviceAccountKey.description: The Service account key that can be used as credentials for the Storage client. It can be loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

storageClass.label: common
storageClass.description: The Cloud Storage class to use when creating the new buckets

storageLocation.label: common
storageLocation.description: The Cloud Storage location to use when creating the new buckets

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

deleteAfterRead.label: consumer
deleteAfterRead.description: Delete objects from the bucket after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls.

destinationBucket.label: consumer
destinationBucket.description: Define the destination bucket where an object must be moved when moveAfterRead is set to true.

downloadFileName.label: consumer
downloadFileName.description: The folder or filename to use when downloading the blob. By default, this specifies the folder name, and the name of the file is the blob name. For example, setting this to mydownload will be the same as setting mydownload/${file:name}. You can use dynamic expressions for fine-grained control. For example, you can specify ${date:now:yyyyMMdd}/${file:name} to store the blob in sub folders based on today's day. Only ${file:name} and ${file:name.noext} is supported as dynamic tokens for the blob name.

filter.label: consumer
filter.description: A regular expression to include only blobs with name matching it.

includeBody.label: consumer
includeBody.description: If it is true, the Object exchange will be consumed and put into the body. If false the Object stream will be put raw into the body and the headers will be set with the object metadata.

includeFolders.label: consumer
includeFolders.description: If it is true, the folders/directories will be consumed. If it is false, they will be ignored, and Exchanges will not be created for those

moveAfterRead.label: consumer
moveAfterRead.description: Move objects from the origin bucket to a different bucket after they have been retrieved. To accomplish the operation the destinationBucket option must be set. The copy bucket operation is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not moved.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

objectName.label: producer
objectName.description: The Object name inside the bucket

operation.label: producer
operation.description: Set the operation for the producer

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

CamelGoogleCloudStorageBucketName.label: producer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageBucketName.description: The bucket Name which this object will be stored or which will be used for the current operation

CamelGoogleCloudStorageObjectName.label: producer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageObjectName.description: The object Name which will be used for the current operation

CamelGoogleCloudStorageDestinationObject.label: producer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageDestinationObject.description: The object Destination Name which will be used for the current operation

CamelGoogleCloudStorageDestinationBucket.label: producer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageDestinationBucket.description: The bucket Destination Name which will be used for the current operation

CamelGoogleCloudStorageDownloadLinkExpir.label: producer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageDownloadLinkExpir.description: The time in millisecond the download link will be valid.

CamelGoogleCloudStorageContentLength.description: The content length of this object.

CamelGoogleCloudStorageContentType.description: The content type of this object.

CamelGoogleCloudStorageCacheControl.description: The Cache-Control metadata can specify two different aspects of how data is served from Cloud Storage: whether the data can be cached and whether the data can be transformed

CamelGoogleCloudStorageContentDispositio.description: The content disposition of this object.

CamelGoogleCloudStorageContentEncoding.description: The content encoding of this object.

CamelGoogleCloudStorageContentMd5.description: The md5 checksum of this object.

CamelGoogleCloudStorageComponentCount.label: consumer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageComponentCount.description: The component count of this object

CamelGoogleCloudStorageContentLanguage.label: consumer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageContentLanguage.description: The Content-Language metadata indicates the language(s) that the object is intended for.

CamelGoogleCloudStorageCustomTime.label: consumer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageCustomTime.description: The Custom-Time metadata is a user-specified date and time represented in the RFC 3339 format YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS.SS'Z' or YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS'Z' when milliseconds are zero. This metadata is typically set in order to use the DaysSinceCustomTime condition in Object Lifecycle Management.

CamelGoogleCloudStorageGeneration.label: consumer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageGeneration.description: Is the generation number of the object for which you are retrieving information.

CamelGoogleCloudStorageBlobId.label: consumer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageBlobId.description: The blob id of the object

CamelGoogleCloudStorageStorageClass.label: consumer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageStorageClass.description: The storage class of the object

CamelGoogleCloudStorageCreateTime.label: consumer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageCreateTime.description: The creation time of the object

CamelGoogleCloudStorageLastUpdate.label: consumer
CamelGoogleCloudStorageLastUpdate.description: The last update of the object

autoCreateBucket.label: common
autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the bucket bucketName.

serviceAccountKey.label: common
serviceAccountKey.description: The Service account key that can be used as credentials for the Storage client. It can be loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

storageClass.label: common
storageClass.description: The Cloud Storage class to use when creating the new buckets

storageLocation.label: common
storageLocation.description: The Cloud Storage location to use when creating the new buckets

deleteAfterRead.label: consumer
deleteAfterRead.description: Delete objects from the bucket after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls.

destinationBucket.label: consumer
destinationBucket.description: Define the destination bucket where an object must be moved when moveAfterRead is set to true.

downloadFileName.label: consumer
downloadFileName.description: The folder or filename to use when downloading the blob. By default, this specifies the folder name, and the name of the file is the blob name. For example, setting this to mydownload will be the same as setting mydownload/${file:name}. You can use dynamic expressions for fine-grained control. For example, you can specify ${date:now:yyyyMMdd}/${file:name} to store the blob in sub folders based on today's day. Only ${file:name} and ${file:name.noext} is supported as dynamic tokens for the blob name.

filter.label: consumer
filter.description: A regular expression to include only blobs with name matching it.

includeBody.label: consumer
includeBody.description: If it is true, the Object exchange will be consumed and put into the body. If false the Object stream will be put raw into the body and the headers will be set with the object metadata.

includeFolders.label: consumer
includeFolders.description: If it is true, the folders/directories will be consumed. If it is false, they will be ignored, and Exchanges will not be created for those

moveAfterRead.label: consumer
moveAfterRead.description: Move objects from the origin bucket to a different bucket after they have been retrieved. To accomplish the operation the destinationBucket option must be set. The copy bucket operation is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not moved.

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.label: consumer
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

pollStrategy.label: consumer,advanced
pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

objectName.label: producer
objectName.description: The Object name inside the bucket

operation.label: producer
operation.description: Set the operation for the producer

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

repeatCount.label: consumer,scheduler
repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.
